name: TreeView
shortdesc: A hierarchical list whose items can contain child items.

property.name: items
property.shortdesc: The array of top-level items displayed in the list.

property.name: itemSize
property.shortdesc: The width and height in pixels of each item in the list.

property.name: selection
property.shortdesc: The currently selected  list item.
property.description: Setting this value causes the selected item to be highlighted and to be scrolled into view if necessary. If no items are selected, the value is null. Set to null to deselect all items.You can set the value using the index of an item, rather than an object reference. If set to an index value that is out of range, the operation is ignored. When set with an index value, the property still returns an object reference.

property.name: active
property.shortdesc: True if this element is active.

property.name: visible
property.shortdesc: True if this element is shown, false if it is hidden.
property.description: When a container is hidden, its children are also hidden, but they retain their own visibility values, and are shown or hidden accordingly when the parent is next shown.

property.name: bounds
property.shortdesc: The boundaries of the element, in parent-relative coordinates.
property.description: Setting an element's size or location changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: location
property.shortdesc: The upper left corner of this element relative to its parent.
property.description: The location is defined as [bounds.x, bounds.y]. Setting an element's location changes its bounds property, and vice-versa.

property.name: maximumSize
property.shortdesc: The maximum height and width to which the element can be resized.

property.name: minimumSize
property.shortdesc: The minimum height and width to which the element can be resized.

property.name: preferredSize
property.shortdesc: The preferred size, used by layout managers to determine the best size for each element.
property.description: If not explicitly set by a script, value is established by the UI framework in which ScriptUI is employed, and is based on such attributes of the element as its text, font, font size, icon size, and other UI framework-specific attributes.A script can explicitly set this value before the layout manager is invoked in order to establish an element size other than the default.

property.name: size
property.shortdesc: The current dimensions of this element.

property.name: windowBounds
property.shortdesc: The bounds of this element relative to the top-level parent window.

property.name: children
property.shortdesc: An array of child elements.

property.name: properties
property.shortdesc: An object that contains one or more creation properties of the control (properties used only when the element is created).

property.name: enabled
property.shortdesc: True if this element is enabled.
property.description: An enabled element can accept input, according to its type. When false, control elements do not accept input, and all types of elements have a dimmed appearance.

property.name: helpTip
property.shortdesc: The help text that is displayed when the mouse hovers over the element.

property.name: indent
property.shortdesc: The number of pixels to indent the element during automatic layout.
property.description: Applies for column orientation and left alignment, or row orientation and top alignment.

property.name: parent
property.shortdesc: The parent element.

property.name: window
property.shortdesc: The window that this element belongs to.

property.name: type
property.shortdesc: The element type, "treeview".

method.name: add
method.shortdesc: Adds an item to the top-level choices in this list.

parameters.name: type
parameters.shortdesc: The type of the child element, the string "item".

parameters.name: text
parameters.shortdesc: The localizable text label for the item.

method.name: find
method.shortdesc: Retrieves an item object from the list that has a given text label.

method.name: remove
method.shortdesc: Removes a child item from the list.

method.name: removeAll
method.shortdesc: Removes all child items from the list.

method.name: notify
method.shortdesc: Sends a notification message, simulating the specified user interaction event.

parameters.name: eventName
parameters.shortdesc: The name of the control event handler to call.

method.name: show
method.description: When a window or container is hidden, its children are also hidden, but when it is shown again, the children retain their own visibility states.

method.name: addEventListener
method.shortdesc: Registers an event handler for a particular type of event occuring in this element.

parameters.name: handler
parameters.shortdesc: The function that handles the event.

parameters.name: capturePhase
parameters.shortdesc: When true, the handler is called only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.
parameters.description: Default is false, meaning that the handler is called in the bubbling phase if this object is an ancestor of the target, or in the at-target phase if this object is itself the target.

method.name: removeEventListener
method.shortdesc: Unregisters an event handler for a particular type of event occuring in this element.
method.description: All arguments must be identical to those that were used to register the event handler.

parameters.name: handler
parameters.shortdesc: The function that handles the event.

parameters.name: capturePhase
parameters.shortdesc: Whether to call the handler only in the capturing phase of the event propagation.

method.name: dispatchEvent
method.shortdesc: Simulates the occurrence of an event in this target.

method.name: onActivate
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the element acquires the keyboard focus.
method.description: Called when the user gives the control the keyboard focus by clicking it or tabbing into it.

method.name: onDeactivate
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the element loses the keyboard focus.
method.description: Called when the user moves the keyboard focus from the previously active control to another control.

method.name: onCollapse
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the user collapses (closes) an expanded node in the treeview.

method.name: onDraw
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the window is about to be drawn.

method.name: onExpand
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the user expands (opens) a collapsed node in the treeview.

method.name: onChange
method.shortdesc: An event-handler callback function, called when the content of the element has been changed
